STM: Struggled with coding assignments, particularly in Java, indicating a steep learning curve in his programming courses.
Expressed frustration with the relevance of some classes like writing essays, highlighting a disconnect between education and career goals.
Landed a summer internship thanks to my dad's friend, a strategic move into quant trading.
Got my hands on some new trading tools, enhancing analysis capabilities.
Got invited to a poker game through a family friend, exploring finance outside academics.
Planning a weekend trip to explore tech startups, indicating an interest in innovation.
Found a quant firm open to hiring without a degree. Sent in application.
Skipped study group to work on a trading model, feeling time better spent.
Composing an email to academic advisor, unsure how to break the news.
I've accomplished more tonight than in weeks of classes. That's telling.
Received onboarding materials from the firm. Lots to go through.
Got the offer! They want me to start next week.
Celebrating with a quick lunch. Can't believe how fast things are moving.
Pilot just announced we'll be landing soon. Time to prepare for arrival.
